about.description:
To use this package in a normal conda environment, do the following

   export CONDA_BUILD_WINSDK=/opt

To use this package in a conda-build environment, add the following

   CONDA_BUILD_WINSDK:
     - "/opt"

in $HOME/conda_build_config.yaml and use `clang_win-64` as the compiler.

By setting this variable, you are agreeing to the terms and conditions
of the Windows SDK and the MSVC headers. If the Windows SDK and MSVC
headers are not inside CONDA_BUILD_WINSDK, they would be automatically
downloaded.
about.summary: clang (cross) compiler for windows with MSVC ABI compatbility

name: clang_win-64
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.19.2
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
    name: clang_win-64
    version: 9.0.1
build:
    number: 5
    run_exports:
        strong:
            - vc >=14.1
            - vs2015_runtime >=14.14.26423
    string: hbfc7cb3_5
requirements:
    build:
        - m2-bash 4.3.042 5
        - m2-gcc-libs 5.3.0 4
        - m2-libiconv 1.14 3
        - m2-libintl 0.19.7 4
        - m2-msys2-runtime 2.5.0.17080.65c939c 3
        - m2-sed 4.2.2 3
        - msys2-conda-epoch 20160418 1
    host:
        - clang 9.0.1 default_hf44288c_0
        - clang-tools 9.0.1 default_hf44288c_0
        - clangxx 9.0.1 default_hf44288c_0
        - libllvm9 9.0.1 hde8ddfe_1
        - llvm-tools 9.0.1 hde8ddfe_1
        - llvmdev 9.0.1 hde8ddfe_1
        - vc 14.1 h869be7e_1
        - vs2015_runtime 14.16.27012 h30e32a0_2
        - zlib 1.2.11 h2fa13f4_1006
    run:
        - clangxx 9.0.1.*
        - compiler-rt 9.0.1.*
        - compiler-rt_win-64 9.0.1.*
        - lld 9.0.1.*
        - llvm-tools 9.0.1.*
        - vs2017_win-64 19.16.27038.*
        - vswhere
test:
    commands:
        - run_test_clang.bat
    files:
        - run_test_clang.bat
        - test.c
        - test.cpp
about:
    description: "To use this package in a normal conda environment, do the following\n\
        \n   export CONDA_BUILD_WINSDK=/opt\n\nTo use this package in a conda-build\
        \ environment, add the following\n\n   CONDA_BUILD_WINSDK:\n     - \"/opt\"\
        \n\nin $HOME/conda_build_config.yaml and use `clang_win-64` as the compiler.\n\
        \nBy setting this variable, you are agreeing to the terms and conditions\n\
        of the Windows SDK and the MSVC headers. If the Windows SDK and MSVC\nheaders\
        \ are not inside CONDA_BUILD_WINSDK, they would be automatically\ndownloaded.\n"
    home: https://github.com/conda-forge/clang-win-activation-feedstock
    license: BSD-3-clause
    license_family: BSD
    license_file: LICENSE.txt
    summary: clang (cross) compiler for windows with MSVC ABI compatbility
extra:
    copy_test_source_files: true
    final: true
    recipe-maintainers:
        - isuruf
